title: How should you read the Harry Potter books? What sequence should you follow? - Quora

response.answer_text: Firstly, the films and the books are very different in some ways, in plot, in setting and in characters, so you have to view them the way you would view different versions of the Robin Hood or King Arthur stories - you know in some stories Robin is a peasant, in some he's a nobleman, in the Disney version he's a fox - they're all telling roughly the same story but they're not compatible, and likewise the Harry Potter films and the books tell roughly the same story but are not compatible. The Fantastic Beasts films will come first chronologically but they are in the film universe, and it's not clear what if anything like them will have happened in the book universe. We do at least know that Rolf Scamander does exist in the book universe, and that he wrote a textbook on magical beasts. As for the books, read The Philosopher's/Sorceror's Stone first, and then the Quidditch Through the Ages booklet which is referred to in the book. Then Chamber of Secrets and The Prisoner of Azkaban, followed by the Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them booklet, which has notes referring to events in CoS and PoA. Then Goblet of Fire and The Order of the Phoenix, and then the little prequelette which Rowling wrote for charity. The prequel is set in summer 1977 so it takes place before the first book, which begins in 1981 - but it won't make sense to you unless you've read OotP first. Beedle the Bard fits in here because Dumbledore is meant to have compiled it and written the notes during the action of OotP and HBP. However, the first time you read it it will probably make more sense to you if you leave it till after DH. Then The Half-Blood Prince, and The Deathly Hallows. Then The Cursed Child if you really want it, but it's so wildly incompatible with the books that its status is really that of a fanfic.

Some Spoilers Below ... The Harry Potter sequence: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them trilogy (movie) [featuring Newton Scamander and set in New York] Chapter 0 (short story; written by J.K. Rowling for a charity, but is now available on the internet) [featuring James Potter and Sirius Black] Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone (book + movie) [Year 1 (also 10 years previous), featuring Harry Potter and a fight with Voldemort over a magical stone] Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (book + movie) [Year 2, featuring Harry Potter and a fight with a teenage Voldemort living in a enchanted diary] Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban (book + movie) [Year 3, featuring Harry Potter discovering the truth about Sirius Black and his father's old friends] Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (book + movie) [Year 4, featuring Harry Potter in a magical contest that was a plot to awaken Voldemort] Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix (book + movie) [Year 5, featuring Harry Potter and the order of phoenix, which tries to deter Voldemort without the knowledge of the Ministry] Harry Potter and the Half-blood Prince (book + movie) [Year 6, featuring Harry Potter gaining knowledge about Voldemort's past and a old potions book owned by Severus Snape] Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows (book + 2 movies) [Year 7 (and also 19 years later), featuring Harry Potter and his friends on a quest to kill Voldemort] Additionally, there are Books such as Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them, Quidditich Through the Ages, and The Tales of Beedle the Bard, also written by J.K. Rowling to supplement the main books.
